intro: Centemopsis biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered centemopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Centemopsis biflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
